rubenchristoffer.hetty

Class HTTPCookieValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • rubenchristoffer.hetty.HTTPCookieValidator

  • public class HTTPCookieValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for validation if HTTPValidatedCookie is eligable to be sent to a given URL based on various criteria.
    Author:
    Ruben Christoffer
    See Also:
    https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HTTPCookieValidator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean validateDomain(HTTPValidatedCookie validatedCookie, java.lang.String domainToValidate)
      Validates domain to see if it is allowed to handle cookie.
      static boolean validatePath(HTTPValidatedCookie validatedCookie, java.lang.String pathToValidate)
      Validates path to see if it is allowed to handle cookie.
      static boolean validateURL(HTTPValidatedCookie validatedCookie, java.net.URL urlToValidate)
      Validates entire URL, which includes its domain and path.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPCookieValidator

        public HTTPCookieValidator()

    • Method Detail

      • validateURL

        public static boolean validateURL(HTTPValidatedCookie validatedCookie,
                                  java.net.URL urlToValidate)
        Validates entire URL, which includes its domain and path.
        Parameters:
        validatedCookie - is the (processed) cookie that client has stored or wants to check for
        urlToValidate - The URL to validate
        Returns:
        true if URL checks out, false if it doesn't or if cookie does not contain domain or path attribute

      • validateDomain

        public static boolean validateDomain(HTTPValidatedCookie validatedCookie,
                                     java.lang.String domainToValidate)
        Validates domain to see if it is allowed to handle cookie.
        Parameters:
        validatedCookie - is the (processed) cookie that client has stored or wants to check for
        domainToValidate - is the domain to validate
        Returns:
        true if domain checks out, false if it doesn't or if cookie does not contain domain attribute
        See Also:
        https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265#section-5.1.3

      • validatePath

        public static boolean validatePath(HTTPValidatedCookie validatedCookie,
                                   java.lang.String pathToValidate)
        Validates path to see if it is allowed to handle cookie.
        Parameters:
        validatedCookie - The (validated) cookie that client has stored or wants to check for
        pathToValidate - is the path you want to validate for
        Returns:
        true if path checks out, false if it doesn't or if cookie does not contain path attribute
        See Also:
        https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265#section-5.1.4
